w:r.w:t: Which of the following are disadvantages of the existing environment deployment scenario? (Choose all that apply.)
It gives you an opportunity to get it right from the start when it comes to implementing an infrastructure based on Windows Server 2012 R2.
Some new features and capabilities of Windows Server 2012 R2 might have limited functionality or might not work at all when this deployment scenario is implemented.

Server management might become more complex because of the need to use separate tools for managing servers running Windows Server 2012 R2 and those running earlier Windows Server operating system versions.
It can help your organization improve server utilization and reduce costs.

Which of the following is not an enhancement that Microsoft made in Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2 to alleviate some of the concerns administrators often have about performing forest upgrades? (Choose all that apply.)
Adprep functionality is now integrated into the AD DS installation process.
The new AD DS installation process includes prerequisite validation to identify potential errors before installation begins.
The Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2 forest functional levels add several new features to a forest.
The Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2 domain functional levels add only one new feature to a domain.
Which of the following migration paths is not supported by the Windows Server Migration Tools?
Migrating between x86-based and x64-based architectures
Migrating between source and destination servers that have different system UI languages
Migrating between physical machines and virtual machines
Which Windows PowerShell cmdlet for the Windows Server Migration Tools can you use to get the set of all Windows features that can be migrated from the local server or from a migration store?
Which tool can help you ensure that new hardware you purchase will work properly with Windows Server 2012 R2?
During which of the six phases of performing an assessment using MAP would you ensure that MAP can successfully connect to and gather information from the target machines in your environment?

When you generate reports after performing a Windows Server 2012 R2 readiness assessment using MAP, where can you find information about the IP address and current operating system installed on each system inventoried?
On the Overview screen of the MAP user interface
On the Environment screen of the MAP user interface
On the Windows Environment Summary screen of the MAP user interface
In the Windows Environment Report .csv file, which you can open to view in Microsoft Excel
Which installation option of Windows Server 2012 R2 potentially has the smallest disk footprint?
What action does the following Windows PowerShell command perform?
It converts a Server Core installation to a Server with a GUI installation.
GUI installation to a Server Core installation.
It converts a Server Core installation to a Minimal Server Interface installation.
GUI installation to a Minimal Server Interface installation

You deployed a Server Core installation of Windows Server 2012 R2 in a virtualized environment running on a Hyper-V host. Because of limitations in available storage space for the host, you want to further reduce the disk footprint of your Server Core installation. Which of the following actions could you perform to try to do this? (Choose all that apply.)
Uninstall any roles or features that are not needed on the server.
Use the –Remove parameter with the Uninstall-WindowsFeature cmdlet to remove the binaries for unneeded roles and features from the local side-by-side store on the server.

Use the –Source parameter with the Install-WindowsFeature cmdlet to specify a mounted Windows Image (.wim) file where binaries you removed from the local side-by-side store on the server can be found.
Use Server Manager to remove the binaries for unneeded roles and features from the local side-by-side store on the server.
Which of the following is not recommended when setting up your build lab? (Choose all that apply.)
Using a Hyper-V host for performing image engineering within a virtual environment
Using virtual machines for testing your reference image when the servers in the production environment in which you will be deploying your reference image are physical systems
Using a DHCP server to dynamically assign an IP address to your reference computer
Installing the necessary tools for building reference images on your reference computer
Which component of a build lab helps eliminate the need to burn boot images onto DVD media to kick-start the reference-image testing process?
A Windows installation that has been sysprepped and captured is referred to as what?
Which of the following is not a software prerequisite for installing MDT 2013 on a technician computer running Windows 7 to deploy Windows Server 2012 R2?
Microsoft .NET Framework 3.5 with Service Pack 1 (SP1) or later
The latest version of the Windows Automated Installation Kit (Windows AIK)

When building reference images, what step should you always perform after importing your operating-system source files, out-of-box drivers, applications, and packages into your deployment share; creating and customizing any necessary task sequences; and modifying the configuration files for your deployment share?
Deploy and capture the reference image.

What is the name of the task-sequence group that controls the phase of the deployment process during which the BIOS of the target computer is checked to ensure that it is compatible with the operating system you are deploying?
Which of the following is not true concerning the LTI approach? (Choose all that apply.)
LTI is a high-volume deployment strategy for midsized to large organizations that combines MDT with System Center Configuration Manager.
You use LTI to deploy the reference images created in your build lab onto systems in your production environment.
You can use LTI to deploy Windows Server 2012 R2 onto physical systems only, not virtual machines.
You can start LTI by pressing F12 on each target system and selecting the option to PXE-boot the system.
Which of the following are benefits of using the ZTI approach over LTI? (Choose all that apply.)
Support for bandwidth management of image transfer
Support for reporting on driver availability for devices across your organization
Tolerance of poor or intermittent network connectivity

You want to use Server Manager to manage all the Windows servers in your environment that are being used as print servers, but there is no Print Services page available in Server Manager. Why? (Choose all that apply.)
All your print servers are currently offline, having been taken down for maintenance.
None of your servers have the Print
Document Services role installed on them.
None of the servers in your server pool have the Print
Document Services role installed on them.
All print servers are running an earlier version of Windows Server and have not been configured for remote management.
How can you verify that remote management has been enabled on a server running Windows Server 2012? (Choose all that apply.)
By examining the Dashboard of Server Manager running on that server.
By examining the Local Server page of Server Manager running on that server.
By examining the All Servers page of Server Manager running on that server.
By examining the output of the Configure-SMRemoting –get command.

Your organization has a mixed environment of servers running Windows Server 2012 R2 and Windows Server 2008 RYou want to manage your servers from a secure workstation running Windows 8.1, so you install the Remote Server Administration Tools for Windows 8.1 on this workstation. Which of the following statements best describes the management capabilities of this arrangement?
You can manage all roles and features on servers running Windows Server 2012 R2 and servers running Windows Server 2008 R2.
You can manage all roles and features on servers running Windows Server 2012 R2 and some roles and features on servers running Windows Server 2008 R2.
You can manage all roles and features on servers running Windows Server 2012 R2 but no roles and features on servers running Windows Server 2008 R2.

You can manage all roles and features on servers running Windows Server 2012 R2, but you need to install the Remote Server Administration Tools for Windows 8.1 on a workstation running Windows 7 to manage roles and features on servers running Windows Server 2008 R2.

Your organization has six servers running Windows Server 2012 in a domain environment. Only four of those servers are listed on the All Servers page of Server Manager. What should you do to ensure the remaining two servers are also listed on this page?
Create a server group and add the two servers to the group.
Create a server pool and add the two servers to the pool.
Add the servers to an existing server group.
Add the servers to your server pool.
Which of the following are not purposes for creating server groups in Server Manager? (Choose all that apply.)
You can assign privileges to servers by adding them to server groups.
You can use server groups to facilitate managing servers at different geographical locations.
You can use server groups to facilitate the delegation of permissions for servers used by different departments in your organization.
You can nest server groups to create a hierarchical collection of servers that mirrors the administrative responsibilities of your IT staff.

You configured the Performance tile on the All Servers page to set a performance alert threshold for CPU usage of 60 percent because when you opened the Performance tab of Task Manager on those servers, you noticed that several of your managed servers were experiencing heavy load. However, three hours later you notice that no alerts have been raised on the Performance tile of the All Servers page, even though the servers still appear to be under heavy load. Why? (Choose all that apply.)
You neglected to enable performance counters on those servers.
The minimum graph display period for performance alerts is one day, and that much time has not elapsed yet.
You configured Server Manager properties to a refresh period of more than three hours.
You have not yet added the servers to a custom server group.
Which of the following service management tasks can you not perform on remote servers by using a Services tile on one of the Server Manager pages?
Changing the Startup Type option of the service
Which of the following Windows PowerShell commands will not uninstall the Windows Server Backup feature?
What action will the following command perform?
The command will install all available roles and features on the remote server.
The command will uninstall all available roles and features on the remote server.
The command will uninstall all installed roles and features on the remote server.
The command has incorrect syntax and will generate an error.
What action will the following command perform?
Because Add-WindowsFeature is an alias for the Install-WindowsFeature cmdlet, this command will install the Web Server (IIS) role on the two remote servers indicated.

Because Add-WindowsFeature is an alias for the Install-WindowsFeature cmdlet, this command will install the Web Server (IIS) role and all of its subordinate role services and features on the two remote servers indicated.

Because Add-WindowsFeature is an alias for the Install-WindowsFeature cmdlet, this command will install the Web Server (IIS) role, all of its subordinate role services and features, and all applicable management tools for the role and its subordinate role services and features on the two remote servers indicated.
The command has incorrect syntax and will generate an error.

If the binaries for a feature have been removed from a server, which of the following conditions are likely to prevent the feature from being successfully installed on the server? (Choose all that apply.)

Internet connectivity is down, which prevents the needed binaries from being downloaded from Windows Update if no local source for these binaries is present on the network and configured to be used by Server Manager or the Install-WindowsFeature cmdlet.

Group Policy has been configured to prevent the needed binaries from being downloaded from Windows Update, and there is no local source for these binaries present on the network and configured to be used by Server Manager or the Install-WindowsFeature cmdlet.

Group Policy has been configured to prevent the needed binaries from being downloaded from Windows Update, and a local source for these binaries is present on the network but has been configured incorrectly to be used by Server Manager or the Install-WindowsFeature cmdlet.

The server is connected to the Internet, but the Windows Update site is temporarily down, which prevents the needed binaries from being downloaded if no local source for these binaries is present on the network and configured to be used by Server Manager or the Install-WindowsFeature cmdlet.
Which of the following statements is not true about background jobs?
You can view them by using the Get-ScheduledJob cmdlet.
You can create them by using the Start-Job cmdlet.
You can temporarily stop them by using the Suspend-Job cmdlet.
You can delete them by using the Remove-Job cmdlet.
What action will typing the command New-JobTrigger –Daily –At “4:15 AM” –DaysInterval 3 perform when it is run?
It creates a new scheduled job that runs daily at 4:15 A.M. on the third day of each week.
It creates a new scheduled job that runs daily at 4:15 A.M. every third day.
It creates a new job trigger that can be used to run a scheduled job daily at 4:15 A.M. on the third day of each week.
It creates a new job trigger that can be used to run a scheduled job daily at 4:15 A.M. every third day.
What two cmdlets would you use to create a scheduled job?
Which of the following is not true concerning PSSessions in Windows PowerShell 3.0?
Any new sessions you create using the New-PSSession cmdlet are saved on the remote computer.
Once you start the remote PSSession, you can disconnect from it using the Disconnect-PSSession cmdlet without disrupting any commands running in the session.
You can later reconnect to a disconnected remote PSSession from the same or a different computer using the Connect-PSSession cmdlet.
You should use PSSessions only when you need to run a single command on a remote server, not multiple commands that share data such as a function or the value of a variable.
Which of the following is not a best practice for performing new forest deployments?
Ensure that each domain has at least two domain controllers to provide fault tolerance and ensure availability. Only one of these domain controllers needs to be writeable; the other can be an RODC.
Make sure that each site in your domain has a sufficient number of domain controllers to service the needs of users for logging on and accessing network resources.
Whenever possible, keep the design of your forest simple by having only one domain.
Install only the AD DS and DNS Server roles on your domain controllers; do not install any other server roles.

Which of the following information should you obtain or decide upon during the planning stage of deploying the first Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2 domain controller in a new forest? (Choose all that apply.)
The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for the root domain of your new forest
The forest and domain functional levels
The location for the AD DS database, log files, and SYSVOL folder
The credentials of a member of the Domain Admins security group
Which of the following is not true? (Choose all that apply.)
Creating a DNS delegation is a required step for all AD DS deployments.
All domain controllers in a domain should have the DNS Server role installed and configured to ensure high availability in distributed environments.
All domain controllers in a domain should be configured as global catalog servers to ensure high availability in distributed environments.
Read-only domain controllers require that there be at least one writeable domain controller running Windows Server 2003 or later installed in the domain
Which of the following procedures for deploying the first Windows Server 2012 R2 domain controller in a new forest is correct? (Choose all that apply.)

Install Windows Server 2012 R2 on your server and log on using the local Administrator account. Open Server Manager and run the AD DS Configuration Wizard to promote the server as a domain controller.

Install Windows Server 2012 R2 on your server and log on using the local Administrator account. Open Server Manager and run the Add Roles And Features Wizard to promote the server as a domain controller.

Install Windows Server 2012 R2 on your server and log on using the local Administrator account. Open Server Manager and run the Add Roles And Features Wizard to install the AD DS role on the server. Then run the AD DS Configuration Wizard to promote the server as a domain controller.

Install Windows Server 2012 R2 on your server and log on using the local Administrator account. Open Server Manager and run the AD DS Configuration Wizard to install the AD DS role on the server. Then run the Add Roles And Features Wizard to promote the server as a domain controller.

Which of the following statements is not correct concerning the deployment of the first Windows Server 2012 R2 domain controller in an existing forest running an earlier version of Windows Server? (Choose all that apply.)

You must prepare the forest and domain and extend the schema by manually running Adprep before you use Server Manager to deploy the first Windows Server 2012 R2 domain controller in an existing forest running an earlier version of Windows Server.

You must select the Add A Domain Controller To An Existing Domain option on the Deployment Configuration page of the AD DS Configuration Wizard to deploy the first Windows Server 2012 R2 domain controller in an existing forest running an earlier version of Windows Server.
You can use the Install From Media (IFM) deployment method to deploy the first Windows Server 2012 R2 domain controller in an existing forest running an earlier version of Windows Server.

If your current logon credentials have insufficient privileges to deploy the first Windows Server 2012 R2 domain controller in an existing forest running an earlier version of Windows Server, you can specify different credentials on the Deployment Configuration page of the AD DS Configuration Wizard.
Which of the following is the best syntax when using the Dsquery.exe command-line tool to verify that Adprep has successfully extended your forest’s schema?
Which of the following Windows PowerShell commands adds the remote server SRV-A to the TrustedHosts list on the local server?
Which of the following is not a cmdlet from the ADDSDeployment module?
Which Windows PowerShell command should you use to run a prerequisites check before attempting to deploy an additional domain controller in an existing forest?
What feature of ADAC enables you to quickly access the last three containers you accessed? (Choose all that apply.)
Which of the following types of directory objects can you not create using ADAC? (Choose all that apply.)
Which of the following Active Directory administration tasks can you not perform using ADAC? (Choose all that apply.)
Delegating administrative control over an OU and the objects it contains
Enabling the Active Directory Recycle Bin
If the recycled object lifetime for a directory object has expired, what state is the object in?
Which Windows PowerShell cmdlet can you use to enable the Active Directory Recycle Bin?
Which of the following are best practices for implementing fine-grained password policies in a domain? (Choose all that apply.)
Assign fine-grained password policies to users instead of groups.
Ensure that each fine-grained password policy has its own unique preference value.
Ensure that each group has at least one fine-grained password policy assigned to it.

Make sure you have configured a fallback policy for the domain. This can be either a fine-grained password policy that has a higher precedence value than any other policy or the password and account lockout settings defined in the Default Domain Policy GPO.
Which Windows PowerShell cmdlet can you combine with New-ADUser to bulk-create new user accounts?
What does the –Force parameter do in the following Windows PowerShell command?
It forces the specified password to be converted from plain text to a secure string.
It forces the specified password to be encrypted.
It suppresses the confirmation prompt that the user normally would have to respond to when performing this action.
It forces the user to respond to a confirmation prompt when performing this action.
What commands can you use to find Windows PowerShell cmdlets for managing Active Directory groups? (Choose all that apply.)
Which approach to ensuring DHCP availability involves dividing up the IP address pool of a scope between two DHCP servers, typically using the ratio 80:20?
Which of the following is true concerning DHCP failover in Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2? (Choose all that apply.)
DHCP failover only supports using a maximum of two DHCP servers.
DHCP failover is supported for both IPv4 and IPv6 scopes and subnets.
DHCP failover can be implemented in two ways: load-balance mode or hot-standby mode.
DHCP failover requires that the DHCP servers be domain members and authorized in Active Directory.
Which of the following scenarios might be appropriate for implementing DHCP failover in hot-standby mode? (Choose all that apply.)
Your organization has a hub-and-spoke site topology.
You want to use the DHCP server in your data center as a standby in case a DHCP server at one of your remote branch offices goes offline.
Your organization has a hub-and-spoke site topology, but you have a limited budget for deploying additional servers as standbys for existing servers in your environment.
Your organization has only one physical site.
Which of the following is not a correct explanation of a DNSSEC term or concept?
DNSKEY resource records contain the public keys for a particular zone.
Only zones that are authoritative can be signed.
The key signing key (KSK) is used to sign all of the DNSKEY records at the root of the zone.
When zone data is updated by a client sending a DNS dynamic update to an authoritative DNS server, the entire zone must be re-signed.
In a Windows Server–based DNS infrastructure in which DNSSEC has been implemented, where is the validation of the response to a query performed?
On an authoritative DNS server in the forest root domain
On an authoritative DNS server in a child or tree domain
On a recursive DNS server that is not authoritative for the zone being queried
On the client computer issuing the name query

When you want to implement DNSSEC in an Active Directory environment in which all DNS servers are domain controllers and use only Active Directory–integrated zones, which of the following steps in the DNSSEC deployment process is not correct?
Begin by introducing Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2 domain controllers into your environment.
After deciding which DNS zone to implement DNSSEC on, sign the zone.
Use Robocopy.exe to replicate the private zone signing keys to all domain controllers hosting the zone.
Use IPsec to protect the last mile between the nonvalidating DNS client and its local DNS server.
When you use Show-Command to open a properties page for a cmdlet, what does an asterisk (*) mean when you find one beside a parameter?
The parameter does not apply to that cmdlet.
The parameter can be specified only from the command line.
Which cmdlet can you use to disable a binding on a network adapter?
What action does the following command perform?
Configures a DHCP server option that assigns the address 10.10.0.1 as the default gateway on any DHCP client whose IPv4 address is on the 10.10.20.0 subnet
Configures a DHCP scope option that assigns the address 10.10.0.1 as the default gateway on any DHCP client whose IPv4 address is on the 10.10.20.0 subnet
Configures a DHCP server option that assigns the address 10.10.0.1 to a router on the 10.10.20.0 subnet
Configures a DHCP scope option that assigns the address 10.10.0.1 to a router on the 10.10.20.0 subnet
Which of the following is not true about IPv6 on Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2?
Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2 have a dual IP layer TCP/IP stack that supports both IPv4 and IPv6.
You can disable IPv6 on all interfaces by editing the registry on a Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2 computer.
You can use Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2 as a DHCPv6 server for stateless address autoconfiguration.
You can use Windows Server 2012 and Windows Server 2012 R2 as an ISATAP router.
The IPv6 address assigned to an interface has a prefix identifier of FE80::/6What type of address is it?
Which Windows PowerShell cmdlet can you use to display the address information for an interface?
What do you need to do or use for Windows computers on an IPv4-only network to be able to communicate with Windows computers on a different network that is IPv6-capable?
You need to do nothing because Windows computers automatically assign IPv6 addresses to their LAN interfaces using stateless address autoconfiguration.
You need to deploy Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2 as an ISATAP router and use it to forward traffic between the IPv4-only and IPv6-capable networks.
You need to deploy Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2 as a Teredo server and use it to forward traffic between the IPv4-only and IPv6-capable networks.
You need to deploy Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2 as a DHCPv6 server and use it to assign global IPv6 addresses to the computers on the IPv4-only network.
Which edition and installation option of Windows Server 2012 R2 are the best choices for deploying Hyper-V hosts in a data center environment?
Standard edition on Server With A GUI
Datacenter edition on Server With A GUI

You want to use a Server Core installation of Windows Server 2012 R2 as a Hyper-V host. The server has been joined to an Active Directory domain and resides in your data center. Because you do not yet feel confident managing servers from the command line, you want to manage the host using the Hyper-V Manager snap-in. Given that security is a concern and you also want to keep the servicing overhead low for your servers while managing them conveniently, which of the following would be the best approach for you to pursue?

Log on to the local console of the server, type powershell at the command prompt, and type Install-WindowsFeature –Server-Gui-Mgmt-Infra –Restart to convert your Server Core installation to a Minimal Server Interface installation. Now log on again to the local console of the server and launch the Hyper-V Manager snap-in to manage the Hyper-V host and its virtual machines.

Enable Remote Desktop on the server and configure it to allow only remote clients that use Network Level Authentication to connect to the server. Now log on to an administrator workstation running Windows 8.1, use Remote Desktop Connection to connect to the remote host, and manage the host from your workstation.

Log on to the local console of the server, type powershell at the command prompt, and type Install-WindowsFeature –Server-Gui-Mgmt-Infra –Restart to convert your Server Core installation to a Minimal Server Interface installation. Enable Remote Desktop on the server and configure it to allow only remote clients that use Network Level Authentication to connect to the server. Now log on to
an administrator workstation running Windows 8, use Remote Desktop Connection to connect to the remote host, and manage the host from your workstation.
Install the RSAT for Windows 8 on an administrator workstation running Windows 8, launch the Hyper-V Manager snap-in, connect to the remote host, and manage the host from your workstation.
Which Windows PowerShell cmdlet can you use to configure the default storage location for virtual machine files on a Hyper-V host?
Which of the following is not true concerning virtual network adapters?
Each virtual machine can have up to 12 virtual network adapters installed in it.
Each virtual network adapter can be configured with either a static MAC address or a dynamic MAC address.
Each virtual network can be assigned a unique VLAN channel.
Virtual switches on a Hyper-V host can be connected to a wireless network adapter on the host system.
Why are pass-through disks no longer recommended for Hyper-V virtual machines? (Choose all that apply.)
Pass-through disks are no longer being manufactured and therefore are difficult to obtain.
Tests have demonstrated that fixed-size virtual hard disks perform almost as well as pass-through disks and also provide the flexibility benefits of virtual hard disks.
Tests have demonstrated that dynamically expanding virtual hard disks perform almost as well as pass-through disks and also provide the flexibility benefits of virtual hard disks.
Configuring a virtual machine to use a pass-through disk is a complex task that might introduce errors.
Although performing checkpoints is not recommended in production environments, they are sometimes used. Which of the following checkpoint actions should you never take? (Choose all that apply.)
Performing checkpoints on virtualized domain controllers
Performing checkpoints on a virtual machine just before applying a critical software update to the guest operating system
Performing checkpoints on virtualized workloads that use data distributed across multiple databases
Restoring checkpoints older than 30 days on domain-joined virtual machines
You want to enable DHCP Guard on a virtual network adapter on virtual machine SRV-B running on host HOSTTo do this, you run the following command:
Unfortunately, running this command returns the following error:
Set-VMNetworkAdapter : Cannot bind parameter 'DhcpGuard'. Cannot convert value
What is the reason for this error?
The virtual network adapter does not support DHCP Guard.
You forgot to include the –VMName parameter in your command to specify which virtual network adapter you want to configure on the virtual machine.
You should have specified –DhcpGuard ok instead of –DhcpGuard:$true in your command.
You should have specified –DhcpGuard 1 instead of –DhcpGuard:$true in your command.

You have three virtual machines running on a Hyper-V host that has 16 GBs of physical memory. The guest operating system installed in all three virtual machines is Windows Server 2008 R2, and none of the virtual machines is a file server. Dynamic Memory is enabled on all three machines and is configured as follows:
Image VM-1 has 1 GB minimum RAM, 4 GBs maximum RAM, and 20 percent memory buffer.
Image VM-2 has 2 GBs minimum RAM, 8 GBs maximum RAM, and 30 percent memory buffer.
Image VM-3 has 1 GB minimum RAM, 6 GBs maximum RAM, and 100 percent memory buffer.
Over time, you find that the performance of VM-1 and VM-2 is becoming sluggish. Why?
The minimum RAM assigned to VM-1 is probably too low.
The maximum RAM assigned to VM-2 is probably too high.
The memory buffer for both VM-1 and VM-2 is probably too low.
The memory buffer for VM-3 is probably too high.
In which of these scenarios might you try to optimize a virtual hard disk by compacting, expanding, shrinking, or merging it?
When the disk is associated with a virtual machine that has checkpoints
When you need to free up storage space on the host
When the disk is associated with a virtual machine that has replication enabled
When the disk is associated with a chain of differencing disks
Which of the following is not true concerning checkpoints? (Choose all that apply.)

Performing checkpoints creates point-in-time images of the virtual machine to which you can return later if needed. There is no interruption to running virtual machines when checkpoints are performed on them.
When you apply a checkpoint, any unsaved data in the virtual machine will be lost.
You can perform checkpoints only when the virtual machine is stopped.
Exporting checkpoints is not supported in Hyper-V.

Which of the following might be true if the primordial pool is not visible in the Storage Pools tile on the Storage Pools subpage of the File And Storage Services page of Server Manager? (Choose all that apply.)
A new storage pool has been created on the server.
The server has only one connected physical disk (the boot disk).
The physical disks are already allocated to storage pools on the server.
The physical disks already have volumes on them.
Which of the following storage-management utilities is deprecated as of Windows Server 2012 R2? (Choose all that apply.)

You have used Windows PowerShell to create two 5 TB data volumes on your file server. The total free space on all connected physical disks is only 2 TBs. What feature of Storage Spaces makes this possible?
Which of the following is not true when deploying Storage Spaces with Failover Clustering? (Choose all that apply.)
A minimum of two physical disks is required.
Physical disks must be SATA disks.
Physical disks must pass the failover cluster validation tests.
What is the minimum number of physical disks required for a storage pool that will be used to provision resilient volumes for a failover cluster consisting of two file servers?
Which Windows PowerShell cmdlet can you use to view the health status for Storage Spaces on your file server?
Which of the following tasks cannot be performed on a virtual disk by using either Server Manager or Windows PowerShell?
Which of the following profiles should you select when using the New Shares Wizard to create a share for storing Hyper-V virtual machine files on the network? (Choose all that apply.)
In an environment in which the iSCSI Target Server role service of Windows Server 2012 R2 has been deployed, what might the following string mean?
This is the IQN of the iSCSI initiator on a computer named srv4.
This is the IQN of the iSCSI initiator on a computer named finance.
This is the IQN of an iSCSI target on a target portal named srv4.
This is the IQN of an iSCSI target on a target portal named finance.
What steps can you take to make your iSCSI storage environment more secure? (Choose all that apply.)
Enable and configure CHAP and Reverse CHAP on your iSCSI targets.
Deploy a RADIUS server and configure your iSCSI initiators to use it for authentication.
Configure IPsec tunnel mode addresses for the initiator.
Configure your iSCSI targets to allow connections from initiators with an IQN of IQN:*.
Which of the following Windows PowerShell cmdlets produces output that you can use to determine the LUN mapping for an iSCSI target?
Which of the following tasks must you perform to be able to manage print servers running Windows Server 2012 R2 from a single workstation running Windows 8.1? (Choose all that apply.)
Install RSAT for Windows 8.1 on the workstation and enable the necessary remote-management tools.
Make sure Remote Management is enabled on the print servers.
Add the print servers to the server pool in Server Manager.
Add the print servers to the console tree in Print Management.
Which of the following nodes in the console tree of Print Management allows you to install new printer drivers on a print server? (Choose all that apply.)
A node representing a print server
The Drivers node beneath a node representing a print server

You want to improve the reliability of print services in your environment by running the printer driver for each printer installed on your print server in a separate process that is isolated from the Print Spooler service on the server. Which set of requirements will enable you to achieve this goal? (Choose all that apply.)

The printer drivers can be of the v3 type as long as the driver’s INF file indicates that the driver supports driver isolation. After the drivers have been installed, you must use Print Management to configure Set Driver Isolation to the value Shared.

The printer drivers can be of the v3 type as long as the driver’s INF file indicates that the driver supports driver isolation. After the drivers have been installed, you must use Print Management to configure Set Driver Isolation to the value Isolated.
The printer drivers must be of the v4 type. After the drivers have been installed, you must use Print Management to configure Set Driver Isolation to the value Shared.
The printer drivers must be of the v4 type. After the drivers have been installed, you must use Print Management to configure Set Driver Isolation to the value Isolated.
Which Windows PowerShell cmdlet enables you to determine whether any printers installed on a print server are shared?
Which Windows PowerShell cmdlet can you use to unshare a printer that is currently shared?

You want to install a new printer on a print server running Windows Server 2012 RThe print device uses the HP LaserJet 6L PS Class Driver printer driver and requires a standard TCP/IP printer port. You used Notepad to create a text file named install.ps1 that contains the following Windows PowerShell commands:
Click here to view code image

You open a Windows PowerShell prompt on the local print server and run the preceding script, but it generates an error. Which of the following could be the cause of the error? (Choose all that apply.)
The required printer driver is not installed on the print server.
There is a syntax error in the first line of the script.

Your organization has two DHCP servers at its central site. The first one is hosted on a computer running the Windows Server 2012 operating system. Which of the following strategies should you implement to accomplish this goal?
Configure DHCP failover. Use hot standby mode.
Configure DHCP failover. Use load sharing mode.

You want to configure DHCP so that one DHCP server handles the majority of the organization’s DHCP traffic and the other DHCP server, installed on the server that hosts the intranet site, only leases addresses if the first one becomes unavailable. The second DHCP server should be able to lease addresses from the entire scope until such time as the first DHCP server is returned to service. Which of the following strategies should you implement to accomplish this goal?
Configure DHCP failover. Use load sharing mode.
Configure DHCP failover. Use hot standby mode.

Which of the following strategies should you implement to accomplish this goal?
Configure DHCP failover. Use load sharing mode.
Configure DHCP failover. Use hot standby mode.

You want to configure these DHCP servers so that they share scopes and respond to client requests in a load-balanced manner. In the event that one server fails, the other server should be able to lease addresses from the entirety of any scope that it hosts after the partner server has been unavailable for a preconfigured amount of time. Which of the following strategies should you implement to accomplish this goal?
Configure DHCP failover. Use load sharing mode.
Configure DHCP failover. Use hot standby mode.

Which records do you need to create to support a new application server that uses both IPv4 and IPv6? (Choose all that apply.)
What command should you use to create a new name server record for ns13.treyresearch.net at 192.168.10.13?
How do you update the SOA resource record?
Use the DNS Manager console Properties of the zone
Use the DNS Manager console Properties of the server
What command do you use to install
VPN and NAT and their management tools?
You need to configure VPN to only support clients using the SSTP protocol. What changes do you need to make to the default VPN configuration in Windows Server 2012 R2?
Add the WAN Miniport for SSTP and set the maximum number of ports. Restart the RemoteAccess service.
Remove the PPTP WAN Miniport and set the maximum number of ports for PPTP to zero.
Clear Remote Access Connections for the WAN Miniport (PPTP), WAN Miniport (IKEv2), and WAN Miniport (L2TP).
Enable demand-dial for the WAN Miniport (PPPOE).

You use DirectAccess for all Windows 8 and later remote clients, but you use VPN to support Windows 7 clients. You need to configure VPN to use IP addresses controlled by the Remote Access server. What settings do you need to make? (Choose all that apply.)
In the Routing And Remote Access console, select Assign Addresses Automatically.
In the Routing And Remote Access console, select Assign Addresses From A Static Pool.
In the DHCP Management console, create DHCP reservations for the IP addresses assigned to VPN clients.
In the DHCP Management console, create a DHCP exclusion for the IP addresses assigned to VPN clients.
In the Remote Access Management console, select Assign Addresses Automatically.
In the Remote Access Management console, select Assign Addresses From A Static Address Pool

You are the network administrator for TreyResearch.net. You have deployed DirectAccess, and initial acceptance has been good, but now some users report that they cannot connect to the corporate network since the rollout, but have used VPN as a fallback. Other users report that they can connect via DirectAccess without problems. Upon investigation, all users reporting that they cannot connect are on desktop computers. What are the possible causes? (Choose all that apply.)
During initial setup, you configured DirectAccess with the Quick Start Wizard.

During initial setup, you configured DirectAccess with the Remote Access Setup Wizard and cleared both the Use Force Tunneling and Enable DirectAccess for Mobile Computers Only check boxes in the DirectAccess Client Setup Wizard.

During initial setup, you configured DirectAccess with the Remote Access Setup Wizard, and added the Mobile Computers Security Group and the Home Computers Security Group to the Enabled For DirectAccess field.

You are the network administrator for TreyResearch.net. Your current network topology has a single-edge device that performs firewall and NAT functions. All client computers run Windows 8.1 and use VPN for remote access. Your ISP has provided you with a single, static public IP address. You have been asked to deploy DirectAccess for remote access, and a server has been identified for the project. The server has a single network adapter. What are the minimum steps you need to do before you can enable DirectAccess? (Choose all that are required.)
Purchase and install an additional network adapter for the identified server.
Install Windows Server 2012 R2 on the identified server.
Install the Remote Access role as a role on the server.
Purchase an additional static IP address from your ISP.

You are the network administrator for TreyResearch.net. After an initial test deployment of DirectAccess, which reported no issues, you have now deployed DirectAccess across all remote users. Users are reporting a significant slowing of Internet access. What are the possible causes? (Choose all that apply.)
During initial setup, you configured DirectAccess with the Quick Start Wizard.
During initial setup, you configured DirectAccess with the Remote Access Setup Wizard and selected Use Force Tunneling.
During initial setup, you configured DirectAccess with the Remote Access Setup Wizard and selected Enable DirectAccess for Mobile Computers Only.
When installing NPS as a RADIUS proxy, which NPS role services are required in Windows Server 2012 R2? (Choose all that apply.)
Certificates with which purposes can be used for mutual authentication of NPS and client computers? (Choose all that apply.)
When you configure NPS as a RADIUS proxy, it means the following:
It acts as a RADIUS client, authenticating all connection requests locally and notifying the RADIUS server group that the request should have access.
It acts as a member of a RADIUS server group that accepts requests from RADIUS clients and authenticates them.
It acts as a member of a RADIUS server group that accepts authenticated requests from RADIUS clients and assigns remote computers to a network.
It acts as a RADIUS client, forwarding connection requests to a RADIUS server group for authentication and authorization.
The connection request policy supports which of the following conditions? (Choose all that apply.)

You have a Windows Server 2012 R2 server (RAD1) acting as a RADIUS proxy and a RADIUS server group with a single Windows Server 2012 server (RAD2) as a RADIUS server in it. You need to configure a second RADIUS server to distribute the load. What should you do?
Deploy a second Windows Server 2012 R2 server (RAD3) and install the Routing and Remote access service (RRAS) on it. Export the configuration from RAD1 and import it to RAD3.
Deploy a second Windows Server 2012 server (RAD3) and install RRAS on it. Export the configuration from RAD2 and import it to RAD3.
Deploy a second Windows Server 2012 R2 server (RAD3) and install NPS Server on it. Export the configuration from RAD2 and import it to RAD3.
Deploy a second Windows Server 2012 server (RAD3) and install NPS on it. Export the configuration from RAD1 and import it to RAD3.
You need to improve the security of your remote access and want to limit the protocols that are used to connect to the RADIUS server. What condition could you use to limit the protocols?
Use a Tunnel Type condition in the connection request policy.
Use a Framed Protocol condition in the connection request policy.
Use an Authentication Type condition in the network policy.
Use an Allowed EAP Types condition in the network policy.

User1 has been on vacation for a week, with his laptop turned off. When he attempted to connect via modem to the Remote Access dial-in bank on day four of the vacation, his dial-in attempt was rejected. However, when he returns home three days later, he initially has a problem when he logs on to his laptop and attempts to connect to the network remotely. When he returns to the office, all is well, although his initial logon seems rather slow. When he goes home that night, he is again able to connect to the network. User1 is authorized for dial-up, and NAP policies are in place for both internal network connections and remote connections. What was a possible cause of the problem?
The connection request policy for dial-up connections has a condition on the Called Station ID that limits callers to the local area code.
The health policy for dial-up and VPN access requires that all client SHV checks must pass.
The health policy for internal network access requires that all client SHV checks must pass.
The network connection policy for dial-up connections is set to enable access.
What configuration changes do you need to make on client computers to support NAP?
Set the Network Access Protection Agent to Automatic.
Enable the DHCP Quarantine Enforcement Agent.
Enable the EAP Quarantine Enforcement Agent.
Use Group Policy to set the Turn On Security Center (Domain PCs Only) policy to Enabled.
When you configure NPS for DHCP, you configure the network policy to enforce the health policy. What settings do you need make in the network policy?
If the client SHV fails one or more SHV checks, deny access.
If the client SHV fails one or more SHV checks, grant access only for EAP clients.
If the client SHV passes one or more SHV checks, deny access.
If the client SHV passes one or more SHV checks, enable access.

Server trey-dc-02 hosts all the forest-wide operations master roles. You want to transfer the roles to server trey-dc-04, and are logged in to trey-dc-04 with an account that is a member of the Schema Admins group. What commands can you use to transfer the roles?
What command can you use to stage an RODC?

ntdsutil snapshot “activate instance ntds” create “list all” quit quit
ntdsutil create snapshot “activate instance ntds” “list all” quit quit
Ntdsutil snapshot “activate instance ntds” “list all” “mount 2” quit quit
Ntdsutil snapshot “activate instance ntds” “mount 2” quit quit
You accidentally delete a user account in Active Directory. What can you do to correct the problem and provide the user full access to their files?
Do a non-authoritative restore of Active Directory.
Enable the Active Directory Recycle Bin and restore the deleted user object.
Re-create the user with the exact same name, email, and SAM account name.
Restore the deleted object with Ldp.exe.
What commands or tools would you use to set a default lockout setting?
From an elevated prompt on the PDC Emulator, type
From an elevated prompt on the client computer, type
From an elevated Windows PowerShell prompt, run Set-ADDefaultDomainPasswordPolicy.
From an elevated Windows PowerShell prompt, run Set-ADAccountExpiration.
Some users are reporting that they can’t log on to the domain. You suspect a Kerberos issue. What settings can you change to temporarily alleviate the problem?
Set the Default Domain Policy for Maximum Tolerance For Computer Clock Synchronization to 10.
Set the Default Domain Policy for Maximum Tolerance For Computer Clock Synchronization to 0.
Change the Enforce User Logon Restrictions policy to Disabled.
Change the Computer Configuration\Policies\Windows Settings\Security Settings\Account Policies\Account Lockout Policy\Lockout Threshold to 0.

Remote sales users complain that they frequently need to run with a local account on their laptops, but they are still subject to the Domain Password Policy that requires them to change their password every 40 days. Upon consultation with management, there is agreement that a 70-day policy for salespeople is appropriate. How would you implement this new policy? (Choose all that apply.)

Create a Sales security group and then use the New-ADFineGrainedPasswordPolicy and Add-ADFineGraintPasswordPolicySubject cmdlets.

You need to configure training lab computers to allow users to log on with their own accounts, but still provide a consistent look and experience for the lab, regardless of departments the users are normally in. What Group Policy settings should you use?

Set Computer Configuration/Policies/Administrative Templates/System/Group Policy/Configure User Group Policy Loopback Processing Mode to Merge Mode. and configure the Computer Configuration/Preferences/Windows Settings and Control Panel Settings.

Set Computer Configuration/Policies/Administrative Templates/System/Group Policy/Configure User Group Policy Loopback Processing Mode to Merge Mode, and configure the User Configuration/Preferences/Windows Settings and Control Panel Settings.

Set Computer Configuration/Policies/Administrative Templates/System/Group Policy/Configure User Group Policy Loopback Processing Mode to Replace Mode, and configure the Computer Configuration/Preferences/Windows Settings and Control Panel Settings.

Set Computer Configuration/Policies/Administrative Templates/System/Group Policy/Configure User Group Policy Loopback Processing Mode to Replace Mode, and configure the User Configuration/Preferences/Windows Settings and Control Panel Settings.
How do you force a remote Group Policy update on the Computer Configuration of Trey-Srv-12?

You are the network administrator for TreyResearch.net. You have to enforce special policies on the Engineering OU in which the users work with highly sensitive information while ensuring that the Domain Password Policy is used. What Group Policy settings should you use?
Configure Block Inheritance on the OU and set the Domain Password Policy to Enforced.

You need to ensure that the ABC software application is deployed to all users in the HR department. The installer for ABC is AbcInstall.msi. What steps should you take? (Choose all that apply.)

Use the Default Domain Policy and add Software Distribution to the policy.

Assign the software package to all HR users.

You need to limit the HR Device Use policy that is linked to the Domain. The policy should apply only to HR Users who are part of the HR OU. What should you do?
Use the Set-GPPermission cmdlet with the -Replace and -Target parameters to limit the GPO to HR Users only.
Use the Set-GPLink cmdlet with the -Enforced and the -Target parameters to link the HR Device Policy to the Domain.
Configure Property Filters to block the Computer Configuration container.
Configure Security Filtering on the HR Device Policy by removing Authenticated Users and adding HR Users.
You need to ensure that GPOs are consistent across the domain and that new versions of Administrative Templates are fully propagated. What should you do?
Configure the Startup script to include Gpupdate /force.
Configure Logon script to include Gpupdate /force.

After thorough troubleshooting of problems with the behavior of client computers in the TreyResearch.net domain, you determine that the Default Domain Policy has significant issues and the best way to correct the problems is to restore the default GPO. What command should you use?
You need to restore the Client Backup GPO from the most recent backup. What command should you use?
Import-GPO -BackupGpoName “Client Backup GPO” -TargetName “Restored Client Backup GPO” -Path \\Server\BackupGPOs
You want to copy the settings from the TreyResearch.net “Client Backup GPO” to the “ClientBackupGPO” in the TailspinToys.com domain. What command should you use?
Use the GPMC’s Restore From Backup command to restore the GPO in the TailspinToys.com domain, specifying the Migration Table.

Use the GPMC’s Import Settings command to import the settings from the most recent backup of the “Client Backup GPO” from the TreyResearch.net domain into the “ClientBackupGPO” in the TailspinToys.com domain, specifying the Migration Table.
You want to provide all users in the Training Department with the same default printer. It should not delete any existing printers. How can you do that?
Create a GPO linked to the Training OU and specify a Printer preference with the Replace action.
Create a GPO linked to the Training OU and specify a Printer preference with the Create action.
Create a GPO linked to the Training OU and specify a Printer preference with the Update action.
Create a GPO linked to the Training Department security group and specify a Printer preference with the Create action.
You need to provide a default power plan for all laptop users running Windows 8. The plan should be applied only to laptop users. How can you do that?
Create a GPO linked to the Win8 OU and specify a User Configuration Power Options preference with the Create action. Specify item-level targeting of a Battery Present.
Create a preference linked to the Win8 OU and specify a Computer Configuration Power Options GPP with the Create action. Specify item-level targeting of a Portable Computer.
Create a preference linked to the Win8 OU and specify a User Configuration Power Options GPP with the Update action. Specify item-level targeting of a Portable Computer.

You need to ensure that all domain computers currently on the local network are using a special version of the Hosts file. You create a network share of \\server\ConfigFiles that has Read permissions for Everyone. You configure a Hosts GPO and link it to the Domain. What settings do you need to add to the GPO?

Configure the Computer Configuration Files preference to have a source file of \\server\ConfigFiles\hosts and a target of C:\Windows\System32\Drivers\Etc\Hosts. Set the attributes of the file to read-only and set the IP Address item-level targeting of the local network.

Configure the User Configuration Files preference to have a source file of \\server\ConfigFiles\hosts and a target of C:\Windows\System32\Drivers\Etc\Hosts. Set the attributes of the file to read-only and set the IP Address item-level targeting of the local network.

Configure the Computer Configuration Files preference to have a source file of \\server\ConfigFiles\hosts and a target of C:\Windows\System32\Drivers\Etc\Hosts. Set the attributes of the file to read-only and set the Domain item-level targeting of the target domain.

Configure the User Configuration Files preference to have a source file of \\server\ConfigFiles\hosts and a target of C:\Windows\System32\Drivers\Etc\Hosts. Set the attributes of the file to read-only and set the Domain item-level targeting of the target domain.

You have configured an NLB cluster of 10 web servers running Windows Server 2012 R2 and IIS. You discover that web traffic destined for the NLB cluster is distributed very unevenly among the individual NLB cluster members. Port rule settings for each node have not been modified from the defaults. You want to ensure that client web requests are distributed as evenly as possible among all 10 nodes in the NLB cluster. Which setting should you enable?

Your network includes an NLB cluster that is used to support an e-commerce site. Use of the site is growing. Whenever you add a new node to the NLB cluster, you receive complaints from customers that items in their shopping carts disappear. You want to reduce the likelihood that users will experience this problem in the future. What should you do?
Enable the Single Host filtering mode
Enable the Multiple Host filtering mode
You have configured an NLB cluster. You want to designate a particular server within the NLB cluster to handle all the traffic that is not caught by any port rule. What should you do?
Enable the Single Host filtering mode

You are designing storage for a failover cluster on two servers running Windows Server 2012 R2. You want to provision disks for the cluster that will enable you to create a storage pool for it. Which of the following sets of physical disks could you use to create a storage pools for the failover cluster?
Three individual disks in an iSCSI storage array without any RAID configuration
Four disks in an iSCSI storage array configured as a RAID 5
Three individual disks in a SAS storage array without any RAID configuration
Four disks in a SAS storage array configured as a RAID 5

You are an IT administrator for Adatum.com. The Adatum.com network includes 50 servers and 750 clients. Forty of the servers are virtualized. To provide storage for all servers, the Adatum.com network uses an iSCSI-based SAN. You are designing storage for a new virtual machine hosted in a failover cluster. Your priorities for the storage are to simplify management of SAN storage and to minimize downtime in case of node failure.
Use Server Manager to create a storage pool
Keep VM storage on a cluster shared volume
Provision volumes from an external Serial Attached SCSI (SAS) disk array instead of the iSCSI SAN
Assign a mirrored volume to the cluster

Your network includes an Active Directory domain named Contoso.com. You have purchased four servers that you plan to configure in a failover cluster. You want the failover cluster to run even if two of the nodes fail. What should you do?
Configure the cluster storage from a storage pool
Add the cluster disks to cluster-shared volumes
You work as a network administrator for Adatum.com. The Adatum.com network includes 25 servers running Windows Server 2012 R2 and 400 clients running Windows 8.1.

You want to create a failover cluster to support a file share used by a resource-intensive application. Your priorities for the failover cluster are to prevent file-handling errors in the event of failover and to maintain high performance as the usage of the application grows. Which role and storage type should you configure for the failover cluster? (Choose two. Each answer represents part of the solution.)
Configure as the role for the failover cluster a File Server for general use.
Configure as the role for the failover cluster a Scale-Out File Server.
Store the share on an NTFS volume provisioned from shared storage. Do not add the volume to Cluster-shared volumes.
Store the share on a Cluster Shared Volume.

You work as a network administrator for Fourth Coffee, Inc. The Fourthcoffee.com network spans offices in five cities in Australia. All servers in the network are running Windows Server 2012 R2 and all clients are running Windows 8.1.

You want to create a failover cluster to support a new file share that will be used by members of the marketing team in all branch offices. Your requirements for the failover cluster and the file share in general are to minimize downtime if a node fails, to minimize storage space needed for the share, to reduce or eliminate the possibility of file conflicts, and to minimize the amount of data transferred over WAN links.
How should you configure the failover cluster and file server? (Choose all that apply.)
Configure as the role for the failover cluster a File Server for general use.
Configure as the role for the failover cluster a Scale-Out File Server.
Enable Data Deduplication on the file share.
Enable BranchCache on the file share.

You want to create a two-node failover cluster to provide high availability for a virtual machine. The virtual machine will host an important line-of-business (LOB) application used often by members of your organization throughout the day. You want to configure VM monitoring of the application so that the virtual machine will restart if the application is found to be in a critical state and will fail over to the other node if the application still is in a critical state after the system restart.
Which of the following is not a requirement of meeting this goal?
The host Hyper-V server needs to be running Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2.
The guest VM needs to be running Windows Server 2012 or Windows Server 2012 R2.
The host and the guest need to be members of the same domain.
The guest VM needs to have enabled the firewall rules in the Virtual Machine Monitoring group.

You have configured high availability for a cluster-aware application named ProseWareApp in a 2-node failover cluster named Cluster1. The physical nodes in Cluster1 are named Node1 and Node2; they are both running Hyper-V in Windows Server 2012 R2. Node1 is currently the active node for ProseWareApp.
You want to configure Cluster1 to perform critical Windows Updates with a minimum of administrative effort and a minimum of downtime for ProseWareApp users. What should you do?
Drain the roles on Node1 and then start Windows Update on Node1.
In Server Manager on Node1, right-click Cluster1 and select Update Cluster.
Configure Cluster-Aware Updating to add the CAU clustered role to Cluster1 with self-updating mode enabled.
Configure Task Scheduler to run Windows Update daily on Node1 outside of business hours.

You are a network administrator for Contoso.com. You have recently upgraded all of your servers to Windows Server 2012 R2. Your manager has indicated that he wants to start testing the live migration feature in a non-clustered environment so that you can eventually take advantage of this functionality in production.

You create a small test network consisting of two Hyper-V servers running Windows Server 2012 R2 named Host1 and Host2. The hardware and software settings on these two physical servers exactly match those of two physical servers in your production network. Host1 is currently hosting a guest VM

You enable live migration on both servers and configure CredSSP as the authentication protocol. You then log on locally to Host1 and initiate a live migration of VM1 from Host1 to Host2. You receive an error message indicating that the VM is using processor-specific features not supported on the destination physical computer.
You want to perform a live migration successfully in your test network so that you will know what is required to use this feature successfully in production. What should you do?
Configure constrained delegation for Host1 and Host2.
Configure Kerberos as the authentication protocol on Host1 and Host2.

You are a network administrator for Adatum.com. You have recently upgraded all of your servers to Windows Server 2012 R2. Your manager has indicated that she wants to start testing the live migration feature so that you can eventually take advantage of this functionality in production.

You create a small test network consisting of two Hyper-V servers running Windows Server 2012 R2 named VHost1 and VHost2. The hardware and software settings on these two physical servers exactly match those of two physical servers in your production network. VHost2 is currently hosting a guest VM named VM2.

You enable live migration on both servers and configure Kerberos as the authentication protocol. You then log on locally to Host1 and initiate a live migration of VM1 from VHost2 to VHost1. The live migration fails, and you receive an error indicating “No credentials are available in the security package.”

You want to perform a live migration successfully in your test network so that you will know what is required to use this feature successfully in production. You also want to initiate live migrations when you are not logged on to the source host server. What should you do next?
Configure constrained delegation for VHost1 and VHost2.
Configure CredSSP as the authentication protocol on VHost1 and VHost2.

You are a network administrator for Proseware.com. One of your servers is named HV1 and is running Windows Server 2012 R2 with the Hyper-V role. HV1 is hosting 10 virtual machines on locally attached storage. It is not a member of any domain.
The available storage used by the 10 guest VMs on HV1 is close to being depleted. At the current rate of growth, the current physical disks attached to HV1 will run out of space in three months.
You want to provide more space to your guest VMs. How can you solve the storage problem with a minimum financial expense and minimum impact on users?
Perform a quick migration of the VMs on HV1 to a new server with more space.
Perform a live migration of the VMs on HV1 to a new server with more space.
Perform a storage migration of the VMs on HV1 to a new storage array with ample storage space.
Attach a new storage array with ample storage space to HV1 and expand the VHD files used by the guest VMs.

You are a network administrator for Proseware, which has a main office and a branch office. The company network consists of a single Active Directory domain, Proseware.com. All servers are running Windows Server 2012 R2 and all clients are running Windows 8.1.

You are a network administrator for Adatum.com. The Adatum.com network consists of a single domain that spans branch offices in New York and London. Within the Adatum.com domain, the users and computers within the New York office are contained in an OU named US; the users and computers within the London office are contained in an OU named UK.

Add the Country/Region property to a resource property list.
2. Your organization’s network consists of a single Active Directory domain. All servers are running Windows Server 2012 R2 and all clients are running Windows 8.1.
You want to enable claims-based access authorization for users in your domain. Which of the following steps should you take to take to achieve this goal?
Enable the policy setting KDC Support for Claims, Compound Authentication and Kerberos Armoring in a GPO at the domain controllers OU level.
Enable the policy setting KDC Support for Claims, Compound Authentication and Kerberos Armoring in a GPO at the domain level.
Enable the policy setting Kerberos Support for Claims, Compound Authentication and Kerberos Armoring in a GPO at the domain controllers OU level.

You are a network administrator for Proseware.com. The Proseware.com network consists of a single Active Directory domain. All servers in the network are running Windows Server 2012 R2 and all clients are running Windows 8.1

On a file server named FileSrv1, your manager has created five new file shares named Finance, Marketing, Sales, Operations, and Legal. On each share, your manager has assigned Full Control to Authenticated Users for both the NTFS and share permissions.

Your manager now asks you to configure permissions to the contents of each departmental file share so that Full Control access is restricted to members of the corresponding department and that no other users are allowed any access. Your manager also wants you to ensure that files within each departmental share can be traced to their origin even when they are moved from their original share location.
Which of the following steps will allow you to meet these stated goals? (Choose two. Each answer represents part of the solution.)

On each new shared folder, remove all currently configured NTFS permissions and then grant Full Control NTFS permissions to a security group that includes all the members of the corresponding department only.

On each new shared folder, remove all currently configured share permissions and then grant Full Control share permissions to a security group that includes all the members of the corresponding department only.
On each department’s shared folder, configure a Department classification property value that corresponds to the name of the department.

On each department’s shared folder, apply a central access policy that assigns to members of the appropriate department Full Control permissions on files assigned with a matching Department value classification.
